channel.title: Changing client port?
channel.description:
Hey, im wondering how you change the port on your client? Im just using a blank 317 client and a blank 317 server.
Everytime I try to run the game I get "Error connecting to server". But when I use Galkon's Client and change the port using the "file" button, it works fine. So... how do I change it if your client doesn't have that "file" button?

item.title: Changing client port?
item.dc:creator: @frostscapeserver frostscapeserver
item.description:
@frostscapeserver wrote:

Muroth:

You forgot client class. Usually a ‘blank 317 client’ would be a 317 deob. They usually don’t contain a Jframe, Gui, or EGUI class. Usually 317 Deob’s connect method are in the client class. Search for ‘server’ in client class if you don’t have Gui EGUI or Jframe class.

Oh true, I though he had like a blank delta or something.
Muroth is probably right.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing client port?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

You forgot client class. Usually a ‘blank 317 client’ would be a 317 deob. They usually don’t contain a Jframe, Gui, or EGUI class. Usually 317 Deob’s connect method are in the client class. Search for ‘server’ in client class if you don’t have Gui EGUI or Jframe class.

item.title: Changing client port?
item.dc:creator: @frostscapeserver frostscapeserver
item.description:
@frostscapeserver wrote:

Sigh There’s more than one way to change the ip/port arham. In this case you should have posted in the ‘Server Help’ Section because the default connecting ip is in the server files.

Find the gui.java OR egui.java and scroll down until you see an ip.
FOR OTHER USERS: The ip should be whatever the ip of the computer is thats running your server
FOR YOU: Unless you are on a different computer than the one thats running your server is on, you should use 127.0.0.1

Read full topic

item.title: Changing client port?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

You hit F1, if that doesn’t work, there must be a button, if that doesn’t work then there is no port in that client/ip changer you are using.

Np,
Arham

Read full topic
